key_points: Donald Trump announced he would skip Joe Biden's inauguration after learning plans to disinvite him.
Congressional leaders, including Mitch McConnell, planned to bar Trump from the inauguration after the Capitol riot.
The details emerged from Jonathan Karl's new book, 'Betrayal,' covering Trump's final months in power.
Excerpts of the book were published by ABC News and Politico.
Trump made his announcement not to attend the inauguration on Twitter on January 8.
Mitch McConnell feared Trump's attendance could disrupt the peaceful transfer of power.
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy reportedly tipped Trump off about the disinvitation plan.
Trump wanted to portray the decision to skip the inauguration as his own.
Liz Harrington, a spokeswoman for Trump, tweeted a statement reiterating Trump's false election-fraud claims and criticizing McConnell and Karl.
Instead of attending the inauguration, Trump flew to his Mar-a-Lago resort on January 20.
